entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from present participle of servir

def.dt: :one that serves others a public servant
:one that performs duties about the person or home of a master or personal employer
:a member of the administrative staff of an international agency

:an employee working with another employee under such circumstances that each one if negligent may expose the other to harm which the employer cannot reasonably be expected to guard against or be held legally liable for
:a person who signs and is bound by indentures to work for another for a specified time especially in return for payment of travel expenses and maintenance
